name: Beef Bulgogi
description: A flexible, Asian-inspired ground beef and rice dish thatâ€™s more about the overall flavour profile than strict measurements. Easy, forgiving, and great for weeknights.
gist: Brown ground beef. Add vegetables (at minimum onion and garlic). Add Asian-inspired flavourings (at minimum soy sauce and sesame oil). Cook a few minutes. Add frozen peas at the end if desired. Serve on rice.
ingredients:
1/3 cup soy sauce
2 tbsp rice wine vinegar
2 tsp brown sugar
2 tsp sesame oil
1 tsp minced fresh ginger
1 tsp minced garlic
Vegetables of choice (preferred: onion and frozen peas)
steps:
1. Cook the ground beef until about halfway done.
2. Add the vegetables. If using frozen peas, wait until the end.
3. Mix soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, and sesame oil together.
   - Often substituted with soy sauce, sesame oil, fish sauce, and oyster sauce.
   - Optionally add a cornstarch slurry.
4. When the beef and vegetables are almost done, add the sauce.
5. Once the sauce is mixed in and thickened, add frozen peas if desired.
6. Serve over rice and garnish with sesame seeds and/or green onions.
